key_points: Spain's second-largest beer maker, Damm, halted production at its main brewery outside Barcelona due to a cyber attack.
The attack occurred on Tuesday night and completely paralyzed the brewery in El Prat de Llobregat for several hours.
The brewery, which produces 7 million hectolitres of beer a year, was able to partially resume production with IT intervention.
Olga Vidal, Damm's head of communications, did not disclose if a ransom was demanded or paid to the hackers.
The company's notification to the police about the attack is unconfirmed.
Despite the halt in production, Damm has fulfilled all deliveries using existing stocks.
Damm produces several beer brands, including the iconic Estrella Damm lager.
Recent high-profile cyber attacks have led to increased scrutiny of security policies by governments and companies worldwide.
A European Union report highlighted the rise in cyber-criminal activities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The Autonomous University of Barcelona and Spain's employment agency were also victims of ransomware attacks recently.
